Message_Intent: The instruction is understood and will be complied with.
The instruction cannot be complied with.

Wait for a reply. Note.— The controller is informed that the request is being assessed and there will be a short-term delay (within 10 minutes). The exchange is not closed and the request will be responded to when conditions allow.
Message received and understood. Note.— ROGER is the only correct Response_required to an uplink free text message. Under no circumstances will ROGER be used instead of AFFIRM.
Yes. Note.— AFFIRM is an appropriate Response_required to an uplinked negotiation request message (e.g. UM 150 CAN YOU ACCEPT [level] at [time]).
No. Note.— NEGATIVE is an appropriate Response_required to an uplinked negotiation request message (e.g. UM 150 CAN YOU ACCEPT [level] at [time]).
Request to fly at the specified level.
Request to fly at a level within the specified vertical range. FANS 1/A-ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft only. ATN B1 aircraft uses DM 6 REQUEST [level], where [level] is a vertical range.
Request to cruise climb to the specified level. Note.— Avoid use of this message element due to potential misinterpretation.
Request to climb to the specified level.
Request to descend to the specified level.
Request that at the specified position a climb to the specified level be approved.
Request that at the specified position a descent to the specified level be approved.
Request that at the specified time a climb to the specified level be approved.
Request that at the specified time a descent to the specified level be approved.
Request that a parallel track, offset from the cleared track by the specified distance in the specified direction, be approved.
Request that a parallel track, offset from the cleared track by the specified distance in the specified direction, be approved from the specified position.
Message_Element: AT [position] REQUEST OFFSET [specified distance] [direction] OF ROUTE

Message_Intent: Request that a parallel track, offset from the cleared track by the specified distance in the specified direction, be approved from the specified time.
Message_Element: AT [time] REQUEST OFFSET [specified distance] [direction] OF ROUTE

Message_Intent: Request to fly at the specified speed.
Request to fly within the specified speed range.
Request for voice contact.
Request for voice contact on the specified frequency.
Request to track from the present position direct to the specified position.
Request for the specified procedure clearance.
Request for a route clearance.
Message_Element: REQUEST CLEARANCE [route clearance] or REQUEST [route clearance]

Message_Intent: Request for a clearance. Note.— Either pre-departure or route.
Message_Element: REQUEST [clearance type] CLEARANCE or REQUEST CLEARANCE

Message_Intent: Request for a weather deviation to the specified position via the specified route.
Message_Element: REQUEST WEATHER DEVIATION TO [position] VIA [route clearance]

Message_Intent: Request for a weather deviation up to the specified distance off track in the specified direction.
Message_Element: REQUEST WEATHER DEVIATION UP TO [specified distance] [direction] OF ROUTE

Message_Intent: Notification of leaving the specified level.
Notification of climbing to the specified level.
Notification of descending to the specified level.
Notification of passing the specified position.
Notification of the present level.
Notification of the present position.
Notification of the present speed.
Notification of the present heading in degrees.
Notification of the present ground track in degrees.
Notification that the aircraft is maintaining the specified level.
Read-back of the assigned level.
Read-back of the assigned speed.
Read-back of the assigned route.
The aircraft has regained the cleared route.
The next waypoint is the specified position.
The ETA at the next waypoint is as specified.
The next plus one waypoint is the specified position.
Clarification of previously reported waypoint passage.
Clarification of time over previously reported waypoint.
The specified (SSR) code has been selected.
Position report. Note.— Reports the current position of the aircraft when the flight crew presses the button to send this message. ATC expects position reports based on this downlink message.
Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to the specified speed can be expected.

Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to a speed within the specified range can be expected. Note.— This message should not be used as it is not supported by the appropriate uplink message Response_required: UM 103, UM 104 or UM 105.
Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to regain the planned route can be expected.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT BACK ON ROUTE

Message_Intent: Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to descend can be expected.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT LOWER LEVEL or WHEN CAN WE EXPECT LOWER ALTITUDE

Message_Intent: Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to climb can be expected.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT HIGHER LEVEL or WHEN CAN WE EXPECT HIGHER ALTITUDE

Message_Intent: Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to cruise climb to the specified level can be expected. Note.— This message should not be used as it is not supported by the appropriate uplink message Response_required: UM 11, UM 12, UM 17, or UM 18.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT CRUISE CLIMB TO [level]

Message_Intent: Urgency prefix. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.
Distress prefix. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.
Notification of fuel remaining and number of persons on board. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.
Message_Element: [remaining fuel] OF FUEL REMAINING AND [persons on board] PERSONS ON BOARD or [remaining fuel] OF FUEL REMAINING AND [remaining souls] SOULS ON BOARD

Message_Intent: Notification that the pilot wishes to cancel the emergency condition. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.

Notification that the aircraft is diverting to the specified position via the specified route due to an urgent need. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.

Notification that the aircraft is deviating the specified distance in the specified direction off the cleared route and maintaining a parallel track due to an urgent need. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.
Notification that the aircraft is descending to the specified level due to an urgent need. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— Ground system will display message to controller for FANS 1/A aircraft.
A system-generated message that the avionics has detected an error.
A system-generated denial to any CPDLC application message sent from a ground facility that is not the current data authority.
Notification to the ground system that the specified ATSU is the current data authority. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft uses this message.
Used to explain reasons for pilot’s message.
Used to explain reasons for pilot’s message.
Normal urgency, low alert
Distress urgency, high alert
Request that a descent be approved on a see-and-avoid basis. Note.— Avoid use of this message element due to potential misinterpretation.
Request a clearance to adopt the specified heading.
Request a clearance to adopt the specified ground track.
A system-generated message indicating the software version number. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft uses this message.
States a desire by the pilot to provide his/her own separation and remain in VMC.
Message_Element: REQUEST TO MAINTAIN OWN SEPARATION AND VMC or MAINTAIN OWN SEPARATION AND VMC

Message_Intent: Used in conjunction with another message to indicate that the pilot wishes to execute request when the pilot is prepared to do so.
Notification that the aircraft has reached a level within the specified vertical range.
Read-back of the assigned vertical range. FANS 1/A-ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft only. ATN B1 aircraft uses DM 38 ASSIGNED LEVEL [level], where [level] is a vertical range.
Notification that at the specified time, the aircraft’s position was as specified.
The code of the latest ATIS received is as specified.

Notification that the aircraft is deviating up to the deviating distance from the cleared route in the specified direction due to an urgent need. FANS 1/A.— Notification that the aircraft is operating on an offset. The Urgency attribute for this message element is not defined.
Message_Element: DEVIATING UP TO [specified distance] [direction] OF ROUTE or DEVIATING [distanceoffset] [direction] OF ROUTE

Message_Intent: We can accept the specified level at the specified time. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67b.
We cannot accept the specified level. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67e.
We can accept the specified speed at the specified time. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67c.
We cannot accept the specified speed. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67f.
We can accept a parallel track offset the specified distance in the specified direction at the specified time. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67d.
We cannot accept a parallel track offset the specified distance in the specified direction. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67g.
Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to climb to the specified level can be expected. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67h.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT CLIMB TO [level]

Message_Intent: Request for the earliest time at which a clearance to descend to the specified level can be expected. FANS 1/A.— Uses preformatted free text DM 67i.
Message_Element: WHEN CAN WE EXPECT DESCENT TO [level]

Message_Intent: The specified ATS unit is being monitored on the specified frequency. FANS 1/A-ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft uses DM 67aa free text. May require to be preformatted.
Normal urgency, medium alert
Normal urgency, low alert
Low urgency, low alert
Urgent urgency, high alert
Distress urgency, high alert
Urgent urgency, medium alert
Urgent urgency, low alert
Low urgency, low alert
Normal urgency, normal alert. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— ATN B1 aircraft only. FANS 1/A aircraft uses DM 67.
A system-generated message to inform a ground facility that it is now the current data authority.

Confirmation to the ground system that the aircraft system has received the message to which the logical acknowledgement refers and found it acceptable for display to the responsible person. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— ATN B1 ground systems uses alternate means, such as MAS message assurance received from FANS 1/A aircraft, to mimic LOGICAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT.
Allows the pilot to indicate a desire for termination of CPDLC application with the current data authority.
Used to report that an aircraft has landed.
Allows the pilot to indicate that he/she has cancelled IFR flight plan.
Notification of estimated time of arrival at the specified position. FANS 1/A.— Uses free text DM 67n. Response_required to free text UM 169d REPORT ETA [position]
Notification of the alternative aerodrome for landing.

Notification of the preferred level. FANS 1/A.— Uses DM 67m. Response_required to free text UM 169c STATE PREFERRED LEVEL. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft Response_required to UM 231 STATE PREFERRED LEVEL.

A system-generated message sent to a ground system that tries to connect to an aircraft when a current data authority has not designated the ground system as the NDA. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— ATN B1 aircraft uses this message.
Notification that de-icing action has been completed.

Notification of the preferred time to commence descent for approach. FANS 1/A.— Uses DM 67v. Response_required to free text UM 169aa STATE TOP OF DESCENT. FANS 1/A – ATN B1.— FANS 1/A aircraft Response_required to UM 232 STATE TOP OF DESCENT.
Notification of the preferred position to commence descent for approach.
Notification of the preferred time and position to commence descent for approach.
Indicates specifically that the aircraft is being subjected to unlawful interference.

Notification of the requested speed. FANS 1/A.— Uses DM 67l free text for partial intent. The flight crew notifies the controller of present ground speed, in Response_required to UM 169b, REPORT GROUND SPEED.
Notification that the aircraft is clear of weather and is able to accept a clearance to regain cleared flight route.
We can accept the specified level at the specified position.
We can accept the specified speed at the specified position.
We can accept a parallel track offset the specified distance in the specified direction at the specified position.
